post.summary: ListS3Backups lists backups stored on s3.

location_id.title: Backup Location ID to list backups from

key.description: Key of a filename on s3.

post.summary: ChangePSMDBComponents manages PSMDB related components.

mongod.description: ChangeComponent contains fields to manage components.

items.description: ComponentVersion contains operations which should be done with component version.

post.summary: ChangePXCComponents manages PXC related components.

haproxy.description: ChangeComponent contains fields to manage components.

items.description: ComponentVersion contains operations which should be done with component version.

proxysql.description: ChangeComponent contains fields to manage components.

items.description: ComponentVersion contains operations which should be done with component version.

pxc.description: ChangeComponent contains fields to manage components.

items.description: ComponentVersion contains operations which should be done with component version.

post.summary: CheckForOperatorUpdate checks if a new version of an operator is available.

cluster_to_components.description: The cluster name is used as a key for this map, value contains components and their inforamtion about update.

additionalProperties.description: ComponentsUpdateInformation contains info about components and their available latest versions.

component_to_update_information.description:
component_to_update_information stores, under the name of the component, information about the update.
"pxc-operator", "psmdb-operator" are names used by backend for our operators.

additionalProperties.description: ComponentUpdateInformation contains version we can update to for certain component.

post.summary: GetPSMDBComponents returns list of available components for PSMDB Clusters.

items.description: OperatorVersion contains information about operator and components matrix.

post.summary: GetPXCComponents returns list of available components for PXC Clusters.

items.description: OperatorVersion contains information about operator and components matrix.

post.summary: InstallOperator installs given operator in given version.

operator_type.description: operator_type tells what operator we are interested in updating.

version.description: version tells what version of the operator we should update to.

status.description:
OperatorsStatus defines status of operators installed in Kubernetes cluster.

 - OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID: OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_OK: OPERATORS_STATUS_OK represents that operators are installed and have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED: OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED represents that operators are installed, but doesn't have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED: OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED represents that operators are not installed.

post.summary: DeleteDBCluster deletes DB cluster.

cluster_type.description:
DBClusterType represents database cluster type.

 - DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_INVALID: DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_INVALID represents unknown cluster type.
 - DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PXC: DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PXC represents pxc cluster type.
 - DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PSMDB: DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PSMDB represents psmdb cluster type.

post.summary: GetDBCluster returns parameters used to create a database cluster

available_image.description:
Available database version user can upgrade cluster to, returned as an image. Image tag contains the version.
If it's empty, no upgrade is available.

backup.title: Backup configuration for a database cluster

keep_copies.description: Keep copies represents how many copies should retain.

location_id.description: Backup Location id of stored backup location in PMM.

exposed.description: DB cluster accessible outside of K8s cluster.

internet_facing.description: Is DB cluster accessible via public internet.

finished_steps.description: Finished steps of the operaion; can decrease or increase compared to the previous value.

message.description: Text describing the current operation progress step.

total_steps.description: Total steps needed to finish the operation; can decrease or increase compared to the previous value.

params.description: PSMDBClusterParams represents PSMDB cluster parameters that can be updated.

location_id.description: Backup Location id of stored backup location in PMM.

restore.title: Restore represents restoration payload to restore a database cluster from backup

location_id.description: Backup location in PMM.

restore.title: Restore represents restoration payload to restore a database cluster from backup

location_id.description: Backup location in PMM.

source_ranges.description: Apply IP source ranges against the cluster.

state.description:
DBClusterState represents DB cluster CR state.

 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_INVALID: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_CHANGING: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_CHANGING represents a cluster being changed.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_READY: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_READY represents a cluster without pending changes.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_FAILED: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_FAILED represents a failed cluster.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_DELETING: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_DELETING represents a cluster being deleting.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_PAUSED: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_PAUSED represents a cluster is paused.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_UPGRADING: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_UPGRADING is a special case of DB_CLUSTER_STATE_CHANGING.
It indicates database cluster upgrade is ongoing.

available_image.description:
Available database version user can upgrade cluster to, returned as an image. Image tag contains the version.
If it's empty, no upgrade is available.

post.summary: GetLogs gets all logs from db cluster.

logs.description:
Log represents list of logs. Each entry contains either container's logs or,
when container field is empty, pod's events.

items.description:
Logs contain logs for certain pod's container. If container is an empty
string, logs contain pod's events.

logs.description: Content of container's log or pod's events.

post.summary: GetKubernetesCluster return KubeAuth with Kubernetes config.

kube_auth.description: KubeAuth represents Kubernetes / kubectl authentication and authorization information.

post.summary: ListKubernetesClusters returns a list of all registered Kubernetes clusters.

items.description:
Cluster contains public info about Kubernetes cluster.
TODO Do not use inner messages in all public APIs (for consistency).

operators.description: Operators contains list of operators installed in Kubernetes cluster.

dbaas.description: Operator contains all information about operator installed in Kubernetes cluster.

status.description:
OperatorsStatus defines status of operators installed in Kubernetes cluster.

 - OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID: OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_OK: OPERATORS_STATUS_OK represents that operators are installed and have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED: OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED represents that operators are installed, but doesn't have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED: OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED represents that operators are not installed.

psmdb.description: Operator contains all information about operator installed in Kubernetes cluster.

status.description:
OperatorsStatus defines status of operators installed in Kubernetes cluster.

 - OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID: OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_OK: OPERATORS_STATUS_OK represents that operators are installed and have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED: OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED represents that operators are installed, but doesn't have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED: OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED represents that operators are not installed.

pxc.description: Operator contains all information about operator installed in Kubernetes cluster.

status.description:
OperatorsStatus defines status of operators installed in Kubernetes cluster.

 - OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID: OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_OK: OPERATORS_STATUS_OK represents that operators are installed and have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED: OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED represents that operators are installed, but doesn't have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED: OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED represents that operators are not installed.

KubernetesClusterStatus defines status of Kubernetes cluster.

 - KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_INVALID: KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_OK: KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_OK represents that Kubernetes cluster is accessible.
 - KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_UNAVAILABLE: KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_UNAVAILABLE represents that Kubernetes cluster is not accessible.
 - KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_PROVISIONING: KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_PROVISIONING represents that Kubernetes cluster is privisioning.

post.summary: RegisterKubernetesCluster registers an existing Kubernetes cluster in PMM.

aws_access_key_id.description: AWS access key id, only needed when registering EKS cluster and kubeconfig does not contain it.

aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS secret access key, only needed when registering EKS cluster and kubeconfig does not contain it.

kube_auth.description: KubeAuth represents Kubernetes / kubectl authentication and authorization information.

post.summary:
GetResources returns all and available resources of a Kubernetes cluster.
NOTE: The user defined in kubeconfig for the cluster has to have rights to
      list and get Pods from all Namespaces. Also getting and listing Nodes
      has to be allowed.

cpu_m.description:
CPU in millicpus. For example 0.1 of CPU is equivalent to 100 millicpus.
See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#meaning-of-cpu.

CPU in millicpus. For example 0.1 of CPU is equivalent to 100 millicpus.
See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#meaning-of-cpu.

post.summary: ListStorageClasses returns the names of all storage classes available in a Kubernetes cluster.
UnregisterKubernetesCluster removes a registered Kubernetes cluster from PMM.

force.description:
If true then Kubernetes cluster will be deleted
even if it contains database clusters.

post.summary: CreatePSMDBCluster creates a new PSMDB cluster.

expose.description: Make DB cluster accessible outside of K8s cluster.

internet_facing.description: Make DB cluster accessible via public internet.

name.title:
PSMDB cluster name.
a DNS-1035 label must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters or '-',
start with an alphabetic character, and end with an alphanumeric character
(e.g. 'my-name',  or 'abc-123', regex used for validation is '[a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?')

params.description: PSMDBClusterParams represents PSMDB cluster parameters that can be updated.

keep_copies.description: Keep copies represents how many copies should retain.

post.summary: UpdatePSMDBCluster updates existing PSMDB cluster.

expose.description: Make DB cluster accessible outside of K8s cluster.

internet_facing.description: Make DB cluster accessible via public internet.

params.description: UpdatePSMDBClusterParams represents PSMDB cluster parameters that can be updated.

image.description:
PSMDB image to use. If it's the same image but with different version tag, upgrade of database cluster to version
in given tag is triggered. If entirely different image is given, error is returned.

source_ranges.description: Apply IP source ranges against the cluster.
